title: 5 Tips for Handling Reactive Dogs on Walks
author: Jane Barkwell
excerpt: Walking a reactive dog can feel overwhelming. Here are five real-world tips that actually help — no gimmicks.
content:
Reactiveness on walks is a behaviour challenge many dog owners face, especially in urban areas like Melbourne. Here are five practical strategies:

  1. Stay calm: Your energy sets the tone.
  2. Cross the street early to avoid direct confrontations.
  3. Use a treat-loaded pouch to reward neutral behaviours.
  4. Get professional help: Work with a trainer familiar with counter-conditioning.
  5. Be patient: Behaviour change takes time.

Always reward calm engagement, and remember: no dog is 'bad' — just misunderstood.

title: Crate Training Basics for New Puppy Owners
author: Marcus Tailor
excerpt: Crate training isn’t confinement — it’s comfort. Learn how to introduce your puppy to a crate in a fear-free way.
content:
Crate training helps dogs develop independence and safety. Here’s how to do it properly:

  • Start slow: Feed meals in the crate with the door open.
  • Use positive association: Toss in treats and toys randomly.
  • Never use it for punishment — it should feel safe, not scary.

Consistency and a calm tone go a long way. If your pup whines, wait for a quiet moment before opening the door.
